intro: Geranium tottum, commonly known as the Cape geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a low-growing perennial with rounded, velvety leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range from pink to red. The plant typically blooms in spring and summer, producing clusters of flowers at the tips of its stems. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
